reviews.review_msg: Clear & knowleadgable
It's too scary, her classroom quizzes always push others to complete, without giving enough time to write. She clearly stated 15 minutes of time, but only gave 7 minutes before turning off the test.
the epitome of disaster
disaster. one of those pesky professors that you will encounter in sfu

She likes to make a lot of mistakes in the lecture, in the slides, answer keys, even the problem sets. I got better results from watching youtube than her lectures! by far shes the worst of the worst. SFU insists we get the same quality education. Her reason for not giving course eval was the pandemic has affected d quality of teaching.......
always make mistakes in the lecture and the problem sets. Bad hand writing(she laughs about it) still didnt try to change. Youtube is so much more concise. Worst prof ever
She is the worse teacher ever. Never do what she promised. And always make students confuse. She makes the course super hard.
Lectures are funny and prof explains knowledge clearly. Do homework every week & practice midterm + practice final

Prof. Kessler is super great at breaking concepts down into digestible examples and isn't afraid to go slower to explain it. Really good lecturer! Her lectures are longer but you do get break - I found it helpful to attend them just because they were so interesting. Would definitely take other courses with her. Study weekly assignments!

Anke is the best econ professor I have encountered so far. Especially for 302 in which I have heard horror stories about. Did above average on first midterm, poorly on second midterm, studied hard for the final and got an A- (I am far from an A student). 302 did not have a required textbook, just do lots of practice problems and you'll be okay!
Worst Econ prof ever had ! Won't take her class anymore

She makes economics enjoyable. The way she teaches may not be your average econ class, but if you pay attention to what she's saying, you will understand econ like never before. The way she structured her class enables her students to think like an economically.
Worse econ prof. Rather have shih en lu from harvard teach me and actually learn something. Brags about having tenure at SFU so she basically doesn't care what students think about how she teaches.

Anke's class was incredibly interesting. I would sit through those lectures even if I was not enrolled! Anke is engaging and energetic. As she mentions, the textbook is unecessary. Definitely do the problem sets thoroughly as they are just like the exams. She forces you to think rather than simply do tons of algebra.

Impatient, mistakes on slides that she is too lazy to fix, unorganized, problem sets somewhat similar to midterms but final was hard. Class is curved like any other econ class so it's all good in the end.

Excellent professor. Clear lectures, approachable, and overall a kind person. Problem sets only were very interesting. Midterms and Finals closely resemble problem sets and examples done in class. Highly recommended. Does not grade on a curve, so be on top of everything!

She is one of the knowledgeable profs in Econ dept but she can spend half an hour on a single slide asking questions that nobody could answer. Midterms were like one hour quizzes. Final wasn't that bad, the average was high. Problem sets were the key to pass this course

302 is hard no matter who you take it with, but Anke makes the class tough. Her exams are rather short so if you mess up on one question on the test, you can say goodbye to a chunk of your grade. With that being said, she is one of the more knowledgeable profs at SFU and you will learn about Econ (though you may not end up being tested on it...)

The midterm was 14 point sth for the first one, and 12 point sth for the second one out of 25. It was low enough but I guess she realized that so the final was extremely easy than 09 and 10 semester. Going to her class won't give you too much help since she teach simple ideas only. DO THE problem set if you want to pass. Method is more important.

Textbook is for background information, all test material comes straight from lecture and problem sets.  DO THE PROBLEM SETS! The information isn't hard, you just have to pay attention and keep up with the homework. Answer the questions the way she answers in her answer keys and it's an easy A.

I did everything by myself. her practice questions are very helpful to get a good mark. midterms and final were short relative to other econ classes. she talks too much and does not listen to people:)you must go over practice exams and problem sets if you want to pass with high mark. overall she is nice, and funny.

To pass the exam, you should answer the questions PRECISELY the way she wanted, as someone below already had mentioned. She gave me -8% over TA's marking b/c it seemed, I didn't answer the question in the way she wanted.

It's absolutely right, she prefers some students over others, she doesn't even care to hide this feeling. Very impatient, the exam is not THAT hard, but it is nearly impossible to get an A, you have to answer the questions PRECISELY the way she wants.
She does not help students, and she prefers some people over others.
She is the best.  Do not usually post anything here, but I needed somewhere to give her compliment.  Her class actually teach you something.  The best course I have enjoyed the most in SFU.

she is more difficult relative to other profs. the course was hard but not impossible like some described. go to TAs if having troubles. the final was pretty easy. as for midterms, use the time wisely and take the time to read her quesions carefully because they are frigging long!
Just 1 sentence. She won't give you a chance to survive!!!
Class average for midterms were below 50%. 25% of the students got D & F and have to retake this course. One of the most difficult Profs in SFU.

really good for a upper division econ course. was expecting this to be really hard but she's making it a lot easier as long as you do the optional assignments and show up to all the lectures because her notes are brief (with lots of typos) and you gotta supplement it with your own notes from lecture. she is pretty unorganized though.
The notes are so brief but the exams are very difficult. Never amend her mistakes in slides. Better stay away from her class.

Awesome Prof, best I've ever had. Challenging courseload, with voluntary assignments you *need* to do if you plan on passing/surviving her class. Some sections push you to the limit, but everything's clear in the end.

Frequently makes mistakes on her slides, which she uploads to the website (but doesn't correct them, leaving the students confused if ever they want to look back at them). In-class lectures are often convoluted and all over the place, therefore confusing for the average student. Nice enough to TRY and make things clear though, unlike other profs.
He is a nice professor with the extremely hard course, straight-forward notes, fair exams, easy to get assignment grades.

His explanations require you to review his notes before you attend the class. He works through conceptual questions in-class that are crucial in preparing for exams. Assignments are a easy 20%. Midterm was around 60%. Would take another micro theory class w/ this prof!
Although it's a tough course, he is really nice prof:)

Exams were difficult but the other students were practically braindead - curved A+ is really easy imo. His explanation of the topics is excellent -he goes REALLY slow over everything so you should be able to understand.  All that's needed is to do the homework and practice exams (I didn't study beyond this) and this course becomes really easy.
I consider Songzi to be a very good teacher for 302. Course is hard, so have to work hard for a good grade. Songzi is fair and all the lecture notes quizzes and tests are posted.

Songzi uses Shi-En Lu's lecture notes and does a decent job of walking the class through the material.  Don't skip class ever: you need his explanation to understand what's going on.  He's a genius, so sometimes he  loses the audience and the students are learning the material themselves at home.  Good thing he posts past exams with full solutions!
the fail rate was generous in my econ302 class only 10 out of 88 people got a letter grade lower than c- which is approx 11% which is a lot lower than the fail rate set by shih en lu(or not?)
Needs to improve his lecture style, he is all over the place. Very difficult to understand because his accent and unclear. Course requires a lot work. TA's were a big help.

Lectures were quite boring and the way that he only uses short sentences to explain question really confuses people. Moreover, his first semester was pretty easy but he made his second more challenging meanwhile he still was teaching easy as first semester. I'd rather he taught more difficult and tests easier than the opposite way.Dislike him!

He is very knowledgeable and helpful. He needs to work on his lecture style but for his first year it is fine. Just go to office hours if anything is unclear he will explain it and teach you what you need. Lecture is ok. Prof is very good.
He has changed his examination material, His exams used to be quite easy, but now they are a lot more challenging.
Class is a bit boring, but very approachable and willing to help students during his office hour. exams are fair
Really helpful after class and in office hours. It is very hard course and I would have failed without him
Your best response function=choose another instructor for 302. Almost no relevant practise problems available in any of the course materials. Assignments too difficult to be helpful.
No Comments
No Comments
302 wasn't that bad with him. Just do the practice questions and exams and you'll be fine.
Class average for midterms were around 50%. 25% of the students got D & F and have to retake this course. One of the most difficult Profs in SFU. Exams are hard and time consuming
Ok ppl I didn't take this class but I feel like saying a few words to the guy downstairs ... You cant even spell things right man ... don't you find that ironic?

Good professor, people who are com painting about the final do not understand materials inside out. Come on, he was graduated from Yale, of course not giving you the identical questions in the final, but definitely  learned from him.  the midterms are similar to the tutorial.
his exams are very hard.  expect too much from students. avoid him at all cost
anyone selling his assignment/midterm? becaseu I'm buying it, please leave a message. Thanks
Exams are nothing like his notes or practice problems...assignments are impossible... very very hard course from him

I took it last summer. Yes, it's hard, but every econ core courses is hard. He did a great job at explaining the material, and you have to give him the credit for that. Attending the lecture is a must. Btw, he's good looking.
Very Very Hard exams...Lots and Tough  assignments !

His midterms are hard, and his final exams are even harder. I wouldn't recommend anyone taking his course. He can't communicate the material well to the class and expects way too much from the students..overall, avoid taking with him if possible!

The material is NOT difficult at all, but his assignments and exams are impossible! His exam is nothing like his Tutorial or assignment questions. He's a nice guy though and he is good at communicating the material, but he makes it tough when he doesn't need to! Avoid!
His midterms are hard enough, he makes the final EVEN harder..he expects too much from students!!!
Notes are ok. But midterms and exams are nothing like notes or practice problems. He is a nice guy, but has just insane expectations of all students to fully understand this difficult material.
Don't take any classes with this prof
She is a nice person, even though the test is harder than the other classes.
The more I took her lecture, the more I am certain I'll fail this class. Textbook somehow is more interesting to read and easier to undertand than her lecture.
Awful, and final grades are only based on final exam marks and never do extra credit. Hard grading. would not take it again

She's nice but she rambles way too much. She doesn't know how to teach (makes concepts way too complicated) so I gave up with her methods. Ended up using ChatGPT for the last month and barely passed the class. 
Tutorials were mandatory which helped more than the lectures. Would take again only because the alternatives are even worse for ECON 302.
awful

Good prof. Always encourage students to answer her questions. Very informative. The good thing is she gives a lot of A+ and As in her session, compared to other profs in econ. It is the easiest econ courses I have ever taken.
He slept during Bill Nye's speech. Best prof ever!!! Easy class
He is the best prof you can choose for Econ302.
Final exam is super hardbut the course is curving so dont worry. Professor Steeve is the greatest prof I have met.
HARDEST FINAL EVER, the practice questions not related to final.
Lecture note are bit hard to understand, but Steeve is really helpful during his office hours. Studying lecture notes and tutorial questions are enough for the exams.
Hard to understand, and his exams were a pain. Don't take this guy's class.

he doesn't really have good structured lecture notes, usually all over the place, but he's very helpful during o/h's. m/t and final were on the hard side, but i think he's a pretty easy marker.  and he marks on a curve too...so that helps a bit.
i took econ 393 with him before and took 302 last semester. the two midterms were very hard. the class average was around 50. but the final was ok.

well..Lecures are easy. He spends a lot of time explaining the basics. The exams are unexpectable. Easy lecture notes don't help AT ALL. He seems easy going and cool but he'll stab you at the back in the exam! BE AWARE!
first midterm class average was 48%... sorta speaks for itself how "easy" he is eh?

By far the best prof I have ever met. He is a prof that actually teach you stuff, and you actually learnging stuff in lecture unlike most of the other professors in SFU. He's very helpful and he will try his best to make sure his students to understand the concept. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
nice prof
easy course ^^ fair MT.

Steeve was so caring that he gave lectures literally from his bed while recovering from emergency surgery, he missed no material even though he had a medical emergency mid semester. He was clear with what the midterm and final would include, so they were easy to prep for. His lectures are mandatory, but I found them to be pretty engaging.
Heavy reliance on exam , gives extra mark due to hard test and quizzes. Hard marker . Had operation halfway during semester .

His exams are super tough. his averages are high due to the whole class being bumped up. Since it's an online course , most of the class hired outside help to do their finals and test. However , He doesn't do anything about it . Leaving the legit students to suffer below averages. TA's marks super hard as well.
The final exam is supposed to be equally weighted but ended putting almost 60% on the last 3 sections. Lots of work.

At first, I thought he was a good grader until I took his class and found that his mid-term exam questions and practice questions are not at the same level. Many of his mid-term exams are filled in the blanks. If your answer is wrong, it means that you have lost even the steps.
He is as sloppy as a prof can get. He does not take his job seriously.

Honestly he is a really nice and understanding guy overall but definitely not the best lecturer. His lecture is so dry but you have to be there for participation quiz games. You pretty much have to teach yourself everything and his notes are so confusing and has a lot of mistakes. Easy grader though!!!!

such a nice prof, records his lectures which is really helpful. teaches the course well and material is quite hard, but if u do all the practice questions then u should be at least average of the class.
He is very nice. You need to practice a lot on the problem sets. Steeve is the best teacher I meet in my study life.
The best prof I've ever met! Highly recommended
Great teacher, just a lot of work

Do ALL the homework and don't miss classes, even if you do not follow or do not understand. The extra points from assignments and attendance puts you SO MUCH ahead of everyone else, especially if you score around the class average on exams. Strict but very clear on structure and grading. Compared to before questions are clearer.

I was scared at first because of old reviews saying he's tough, but Shih En is actually very kind and supportive. He added attendance scores not to fail students from low exam grade and always listens to students. He never ignores even “stupid” questions and explains concepts really well. Don't be spooked by old reviews! He is the best prof at SFU.

He is someone who is very passionate about economics and game theory in particular. Lectures were 3hours long, which is just tough. He does have recorded lectures from 2020, which were a massive help. Exams are incredibly hard. Felt like I ran a marathon after. Definitely hurts the soul a bit. Nice guy tho. Midterm avg = 48% Final avg = (wait).
Typical arrogant PHD who thinks he is better than everyone, but he teaches well.

Shih En has an obvious passion for the subject. If you don't plan on cheating in the class you'll be fine. He is one of the few profs that actually want in depth criticisms of his course and I appreciate that. Definitely knowledgeable and going to his office hours was worth. 10/10 ate and left no crumbs.

This prof is passionate about Econ, you can tell he puts a LOT of care into this course. He explains concepts very clearly but in very mathematical terms. I recommend taking this course if you want to understand Econ concepts at a deep level. I learned so much from him. Don't take it if you just want to pass the course. It's really difficult.

sum: talented person but a horrible teacher. Extremly hard but fun contents. He is a smart guy immersing in his own world and ignoring the absorption ability of students. The biggest problem is the exam is 0-correlated with problem set. if the diffculty of problem set is 1,then the the diffculty of exam is 100.

He graduated from Harvard, he is a very intelligent person, logically clear and rigorous, but you will never understand your mid-term final exam. The average score for all exams is almost 20 to 30%. You can imagine how frustrated you will be after exams.

If you like econ and dont mind spending 3 hours before moving onto part b of question 1, Shih En is your guy. This is a challenging course but he gives you all the necessary tools to understand whats going on. Wish all econ courses were taught like this tbh

To be really honest, He is a talented person but a horrible teacher. He doesn't provide any helpful information, which relates to exams. In fact, his brief teaching style leads to an awful learning experience for average students. NEVER take his sections, if you are not smart enough.
You are self-teaching a very difficult course. The midterm was ridiculous and you get 0 help. DO NOT TAKE if you care about your gpa
I don't even know what he wants me to know. There is no useful practice. He doesn't explain concepts and you're basically left to learn a very difficult course on your own.

His lecture slides are brief but he says there's no textbook to help learn it. He spends no live time actually going over concepts. He has problem sets every week and those are brutal to do. His lectures dont help solve them and he laughs when you ask question. Being online it is even worse and I would not reccomend. AWFUL.
Great professor! The lecture is well organized, and the explanation of each point is clear.

If you want to go to graduate school for econ, he's a great starting point. If you simply want to pass 302, probably avoid his class. The only upside is that getting 20% all the way through the course can land you a B due to the curve. It's also a pretty empty class because everyone avoids him, so a lot of one on one if you want it.
He is the worst Professor ever. Avoid at all costs. He is not helpful at all and expects everyone to know everything.

He is a good prof and he really wants you to learn than just take the easy way out and memorize! I admire his intentions, but he also has a really strict attitude, and his comments can be discouraging at times. Also the lecture slides are not at all enough for learning the material, and solutions are tough to understand. Take if really interested!

Maybe the smartest prof I have met in SFU. Because of his unusual intelligence, His lecture is not easy, if you do not prepare for the material. The midterm is not hard, but his final is extremely difficult that most people earn lower than 30%. In sum, if you wannna challenge yourself and really like economics, this guy may be your best choice.

If you are willing to devote time and interested in Game Theory, it's worth taking the course. He is quick minded and clever. Talking to him can be a painful experience if you are not prepared enough but if you think by yourself before ask you will be offered more information than you can even imagine. Attending lectures is a must.
Do not take if you have a choice. Exams are really really hard!!

Attendance isn't mandatory, but it'll be near impossible to pass without. Very little use for textbooks. Not the easiest prof, but the math required is much less complex than my 201 prof asked for on tests. He's a bit impatient, though.
really helpful if you attend all classes. of course, not an easy course at all. this prof makes this course interesting though.
if you want great mark, you'd better understand evrything he talks. remeber the pattern is not enough.
Really informative and challenging course. Worth to take.

Really intelligent prof as evidenced by his harvard CV and if you pay attention in class, you'll learn economics like never before. Nevertheless, unless you're 110% committed, chances are you will flunk his class. His slides do not even come close to giving you an idea of the kinds of questions his assignments and exams are made up of.
He is a very smart and strict professor...His exams are really hard! But he explains details very clear in class.

He`s a really tough prof, but if you go to his OH he explains things very clearly. If you`re having trouble, you HAVE to go to OH or ask for help from TA. You won`t figure it out from looking at the notes.

Lecture notes are very general, studying hard won't be enough to do well on assignments or exams.  Class average on his exams are less than 20%.  Seems to get a kick out of almost everyone in the class failing (non scaled score).

Stay away from this person.  If you want to pass, avoid him.  If you think you want to give yourself a challenge, you will deeply regret it.  If you think with hard work you will earn a respectable grade, you are wrong.
extremely hard and strict prof, his exams are full of advanced calculus!!! avoid him at all cost

One of the hardest classes at SFU paired with an  harder professor. The average for this class is failing whereas the average in the other professor's class was 85%, he states that because we have had a difficult exam we "feel better" when we answer a question correctly, however, good luck even answering any questions on the final.

Assignments were not that hard, quiz is easy but you have to pay attend, and midterm exam were harder and trickier than quiz. However, I learned lots in this course and now I feel other econ courses are not so hard.

I must say that i hate him so much at the beginning of this course. Assignments were hard, and exams were even harder than most of the assignments. However, I also must say thai I learned "LOTS" in this course. This course totally changed my thoughts that econ courses are useless, and now i feel other econ courses are not so hard. Great job for him
He is very intelligent ,I think Sfu need more prof like him

assignments are as hard as exams or even harder, yet you could get perfect mark on it by completing it. Midterm was easy, final was harder. People who complain on this board are those don't know how to study. Shih En's class is harder than any others, but if you put enough effort on it, it is all doable. also better if you are good at math.

This prof is awesome. For all of you out there that actually know any econ you will find this guy great. He doesnt mess about with just showing yo how to answer questions he will ensure that you have an intuitive understanding of the material, which will help you in ALL your other courses! I love this prof!
Extremely high expectations. And this is the most stressful course I have ever taken. Weekly assignments that requires roughly 5-8 hours.. He is very very very strict

The class itself is naturally hard despite what everyone else say and its suppose to be that way.  You will do fine in the course as long as you visit his and TA's OH and ask questions. He doesn't teach you grad level material, its just that SFU math req doesnt prepare you for advance math. Though his lectures are oversimplified compared.

This prof is awesome! It's really great that The textbook is totally useless and we have no other books recommended for reference! Ideas Taught in lec are basic, but the assignments and exams are hard.

Shih en is probably the hardest prof Ive had in my university years. The exams/assignments are incredibly hard. However if you work hard you can learn alot from him.  If you just wannna pass dont take him but if the aim is to really learn, he is the best prof. The level of teaching is very valuable.

Assignments and exams extremely hard and time consuming, he's not helpful at all during office hours and just puts a smile on .  The TA's couldnt even solve the assignment questions. the class material is not covered at all in the text book. and the lecture notes are useless in preparing for the exam. If you can, avoid this guy at all costs

This is his first teaching in SFU, so he does not have teaching skills at all. Lectures are quite broad and highly math intensive. His lecture notes are too brief to study and even useless to solve assignments. Exams looks like it came from another world for students. Don't get disguised by his smiling face. be diplomatic. I warned.
The course is hard enough, but if you really put time and study very hard then you will learn lots of things. This is the only course I would agree that the course is worth the tuition at SFU.
This prof thinks he's teaching at harvard

Notes are useless because they are brief. Problem Sets are way too difficult for undergraduate level. Exam's are unfair with unrealistic expectations. He is clearly teaching this course at a Masters level and making it more difficult than it has to be.

This prof is awesome!! I feel like I'm learning with uncertainty and discouragement. Extremely hard assignments, midterm and overall materials. He provides really general overview of each model and expects us knowing how to apply into some extremely hard comprehensive questions. I have no idea what is wrong with him. TAs are completely useless....

He is keeping remind us how many students are in the failing range. I don't think this should be as a goal of being a teacher. If in the case Lu thinks SFU students are not smart enough to reach his "easy mode" and without any concerns of teaching problem, then I think our SFU is not his place.

Shih-En is very approachable, but this guy is by far the toughest prof I've ever had. Study from assignments and notes because ALL recommended texts are completely useless. Go seek TA help ASAP since they're much clearer than the prof. Also make sure you at least try every assignment and not skip; they're the much needed free marks in this class.

He gives you the most basic, simple examples in class. Then on the Problem Sets the questions are extremely complex. If you don't understand, there is no where to turn cause the textbook is useless and the slides are too basic. This is university. TEACH material, then TEST on that material. Don't teach one thing, and test another. Come on Harvard

This guy is unbelievable... Slides are brief and often skip steps, the textbooks are useless as he does not follow them. He goes through the most basic examples in class then gives you ridiculously hard questions on the assignments and exams. 31% average on the midterm, avoid him at all costs. Even the TAs had trouble solving the questions in TUT

Even though I would like to give this guy a break because he is new, I feel I have to inform students who will be taking his class in the future. Beware of his friendly smile. All of the comments here are true. ShiHen needs some time to improve his social skills but in the mean time we will have to go through these rocky times with him as he grows.
Holy Mama! Econ De Voyage! Beware :D

He teaches the course like grad school level! After the insane midterm, I just couldn't follow his lectures. Notes on the slides are brief and unclear, often skipping steps. Problem sets were harder than in-class exercises
Pay SFU tuition, enjoy Harvard education :(
Even harder than 3level math and stat courses

Getting our money's worth. Teaching grad school level material to the class. It's unfair people say SFU is not Harvard level. School is just a vehicle, the content we learn is all the same. That said, his class is by no mean easy. MT avg was 31%. I've never failed a MT, but the surprise was I was still a sigma above the avg. Just do your best.
He assigned 3 textbooks at the begining of the class, but he follow none of them. The exam is crazy, the highest mark for midterm is54%, avg around 30% . Is that fun?

1st semester teaching at sfu after gettin his PHD from Harvard. Does not have any practice exams to give out and only tell the class to study assignment questions and then give a MT thats nothing similar. 30% class avg on MT. 302 is hard but the usual avg for mt is around 50-55%, not 30%! hes worst than C.Lufessman
fair MTs x2 , as long as you went to tutorial and did those practice problems. Final was a little bit tricky but in general a great prof. Must attend class, useful notes.
2 mts were fair...final was difficult
Fair midterms, but pretty hard final. Notes are pretty good. In closing words, if I were to take another course with him, I would.
Really an easy 302 prof?her notes are very helpful for exams. Choose her if u want an A?But still need efforts?
tricky midterms but final was easy.

She is very good, and her notes are great for studying, don't need to use the textbook at all. Exams require lots of preparation but she gives you everything you need. Notes are handwritten though so to have the best notes, attend lectures.
Please take her class easy and only final around 20%
